thread.title: Acuff, Standage lead the way after day 1 of state golf
thread.title_full: Acuff, Standage lead the way after day 1 of state golf

title: Acuff, Standage lead the way after day 1 of state golf
text: Posted : Monday, 12 October 2015 6:13PM Acuff, Standage lead the way after day 1 of state golf Mike Scott Reporting mscott1@schurz.com SPRINGFIELD, Mo. -- We are half way home at the girls state golf tournaments and a pair of Ozarks golfers are in contention for the title. Kickapoo's Ari Acuff is in a three-way tied for 2nd place at the Class 2 tournament held at Rivercut Golf Course in Springfield. Acuff's 3-over par 74 is three strokes behind leader Taylor BeDell from Warrensburg. Rogersville's Lindsey Standage is in second place by herself at the Class 1 tournament held at Joplin's Twin Hills County Club. Standage fired an par opening round 2-over par 73 just one stroke behind leader India Gaume from Pembroke Hill. Camdenton's Amber Wilson is in 7th place in Class 2 leading the Lakers who are currently in 2nd place, eight strokes behind Blue Springs. Both tournaments wrap up Tuesday. O-Zone will have stories, photos and video from both Rivercut and Twin Hills.
